Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: blackbond_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the bus and train station. The rooms were air conditioned, very clean and a decent size. We could even see the grand canal from our room without falling out of the window. The staff were friendly and offered a breakfast of both savoury and sweet options and cappuccino! Remember, like most hotels in europe there's no elevator so pack what you can lift.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Antica Casa Carettoni is a wonderful little hotel on Lista di Spagna, one of my favourite areas in Venice. The hotel is small but delightful, lovely marble staircases and mosaic floors and glass chandeliers. My room was a double and had plenty of room, it faced the main street and was totally quiet with the windows closed. The bathroom was small but just right, the hotel and rooms were spotlessly clean, the air con was perfect in the Venetian heat. And not a mosquito to be seen ! All staff were wonderful and Elisa was so charming at breakfast and on the reception, I had no complaints at all about this hotel five stars all round from me. The breakfast was lovely and at least 5 choices of cakes ( my favourite ) cereals, bread and cheeses, coffe was also very good. I will certainly recommend this hotel to friends and family, and most definitely return, I got such a great deal with Hotelclub/Orbitz absolutely delightful

Reviews.Title: “A cosy and comfy hotel hidden in an old building - a perfect service”
Reviews.Author: rumaribeiro
Reviews.Content: I've been on a business trip to Venice (for the Venice Film Festival) and stayed at the Caretoni. The rooms are nicely decorated in the venetian style and are very comfortable, the breakfast is also very good but the special gem of this hotel is the service. The rooms are very clean and the cleaner (a shy oriental girl) is very efficient. I've had problems in receiving an important fax and e-mail needed for the Festival and Elisa who is the Receptionist was extremely helpful, she did what she could to help me and finally, due to her assistance, all went well. If you go to Venice, I strongly recommend the Antica Casa Carettoni.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful Staff, Tiny Room & Sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: yssunil
Reviews.Content: We had been here from 20-22 Aug 2011. Thumbs Down ---------------------- 1. Mosquitoes - Too Many. The hotel staff care a damn to help by giving excuse of "Venice Problem". They do not even provide a repellant. Pathetic!! 2. Room Size - Too Too tiny (See my Pic). French Bed. we are thin and still could not fit in. Even 2 suitcases cannot be kept. 3. AC/FAN - No Fan. AC Does not work. They ask us to keep windows closed to enable ac to switch on. But it never switched on. Summer nights were horrible. All 2 nights we could not sleep. 4. BREAKFAST - avoid.. looked like it was just a formality. No Choices. Breads were bad. 5. Staff - keep changing frequently. saw 5 receptionists at 5 diff times. Few were very rude/unhelpful/uncourteous. DEPRESSING 6 INTERNET - No wifi. They provide LAN cables and that too take 10Euro Deposit. What the heck!!! Thumbs Up ------------------ 1. Proximity - Just next to rail station and to bus station 2. Location - On the main street of Lista Di Spagna - Always buzzing with activities Avoid this. It was disastrous. It is better to stay in good hotels in Mestre..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, spacious and comfortable accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Watts51
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Antica Casa Carettoni for 2 nights in early July. I arrived in Venice by train and was very pleased to find my hotel located on Lista Di Spagna, a short walk from the station, lined with gorgeous cafe's, restaurants and gift shops. The double room was spacious, clean, well decorated and affordable for such a great location. Everything you want to see is within walking distance including Ferrovia station for water taxis to San Marco square and Rialto Bridge. But I found myself drawn back to Lista Di Spagna for great dining and shopping.The only complaint I can think of was the continental breakfast. Overall, would definately return for another stay!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: lostinatlanta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location just a 5 minute walk from the train station, which is especially important in Venice. Otherwise you'll have to lug suitcases up and down bridges to get to your hotel. I saw many people lugging huge suitcases around Venice whereas I only had a 5 minute walk. The hotel appears to have been completely remodeled and it is very nice, but a few things to be aware of : 1. There are no elevators. It was not a lot of fun carrying a 40lbs suitcase up three flights of stairs. 2. The rooms are nicely priced but you get what you pay for. The room was really really tiny. My wife and I could barely stand up in the room together. All in all it is a nice hotel at a great price. I would stay there again if I had the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Richard A B 1
Reviews.Content: I have had a short break in Venice during June 2011. I stayed at the Antica Casa Carettoni Hotel near the railway station for four nights; it was a good choice in a good location. Vehicles coming to Venice can reach the Plazzale Roma, where the bus station and car parks are located; from here it was a ten minute walk to the hotel including using one bridge over the Canal Grande. From the hotel it was easy to walk to Ponte di Rialto (Rialto Bridge) and Piazza San Marco (Saint Markâ€™s Square). The room was small, but this didnâ€™t matter as I didnâ€™t spend much time in it. The room was also clean and had en suite facilities, air conditioning and a safe. Elisa at reception was very helpful. She provided a map of the city, recommended restaurants, which were good and advice on the merits of purchasing a Venice Card which provided access to some sites in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: rishin11
Reviews.Content: I managed to book this hotel a night before I was due to reach Venice through lastminute.com. It ticked all the boxes we were looking for in hotel. Comfortable rooms, gooood breakfast incl in price, clean bathroom, helpful staff and above all it was stone's throw from St Lucia Station. If you are travelling to and from station this is the place to be in. We have seen numerous tourist carrying their suitcases over the canals and on the cobbled streets searching their accomodations through confusing streets of venice. I think we made a great decision by selecting Antica Casa. Oh and we could see grand canal from main window of our room (had to lean over to get that view)!!! Negative thing is if you're travelling with heavy suitcases, you will have to carry them up a level to reach reception and then one/two more levels to your room. Secondly they do not have wi-fi in rooms. However they do have cable connections and you have to get the cable from reception and return it on departure. Wasn't a negative for us, just thought of letting people know. Overall I would definitely stay there again and would definitely recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal spot”
Reviews.Author: YYC_wayfarer
Reviews.Content: This was such a nice find. Yes as you have probably read from others it is small but really how much time are you spending in your room?? You're in Venice! The rooms were very clean and quaint, and the beds comfortable although every night we were exhausted from walking all day and probably could have slept soundly on a table (all the fantastic wine didn't hurt either :) ) The location is a nice 10 minute walk away to the Rialto bridge and we even found a casino in a huge mansion along the way. The train station, or bus station too, is a scant minute or two away from the hotel. To get the keys for the room you need to stop at Zechini first which is beside the hotel. Can't comment on the breakfast as we always ate out and about. Perfect location for exploring and you are well away from most of the tourist madness that is Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “great things can come in small places”
Reviews.Author: tempetownlake
Reviews.Content: only steps away from public transportation - train station very close, exit turn left and just a few yards away is hotel; cross the bridge in front of station or to the right of train station takes you to bus station and airport shuttle - 5-10 minute easy walk. venice is an easy walk and adventureous but can follow signs on buildings takes you to and from tourist sites. Hotel itself is really clean and very cozy elegant, marble. only drawback is stairs, there is no lift. but if pack for a european vacation the right way than shouldn't be a problem. coin laundry easy walk from hotel, cross bridge, ;take right off stairs than first left and will lead you right into laundry. lido beach is great

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in paradise”
Reviews.Author: zzdianne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location in the heart of Venice just a couple of minutes walk from the St Lucia train station and close to the cruise terminal. Hotel staff were friendly and very helpful. Our room with bathroom was charming and spotlessly clean. Nice breakfast in hotel next door. We thought this hotel was excellent value for the position and we will certainly stay here again when next in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “nice but small”
Reviews.Author: tinatavira
Reviews.Content: My experience in venice is that everithing is expensive. This smal hostel is part of a group of 3 hotels by the same owner and sometimes gest can be changed between them. This hotel is extremly small, but pleasently decorated and clean. The room was very small but clean and the bed confortable. several tv chanels available. In the small bathroom the cabin shower was a good surprise. Most of the days I had a simple breakfast at the hotel next door, because there were few people staying there. Centraly located, near the main trainstation of Sta Lucia. Good for tourists with no children, without disabilities. Good price for fair service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Trish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for Venice if you can get a good price - I booked through Venere at 200Euro / night, not bad, but seems you can do better by calling direct. Very easy walk from the train station, and an excellent street location !! Very quiet despite being on a main tourist street. Rooms were very nice and VERY clean. I would definately recommend. Only catches - AC doesn't get turned on until June, tough if you are there on a sticky May day ! The reception (and occasionally b'fast) is shared with Zucchini, but really no big issue. Stairs and no elevators - beware if you are infirm or out of shape. I would highly recommend this hotel if you need somewhere with good loctaion, and a clean, quiet, high grade room !

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel of a room”
Reviews.Author: travlngal
Reviews.Content: The room was like a jewelry box, tiny but exquisite. No reservations, we came wandering down the street at 10pm with bags. Man at entrance lured us in. Lovely, inlaid marble floors, spotless, beautiful wood furniture, great bathroom with multiple shower heads, water pressure good. Tiny tiny, with a window over the street from the station, good for people watching, best breakfast including soft boiled eggs, yum! Would stay again, the rooms are all different so would ask to see a larger one next time. I will check it again in two months.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise -- With One Caveat”
Reviews.Author: Available
Reviews.Content: My reservation actually was with the Zecchini, but when I arrived, they put me at a hotel up the street named the ANTICA CASA CARETTONI. I was pleasantly surprised by the Antica Casa Carettoni. The rooms seemed to have been remodeled very recently, clean and comfortable. The private bathroom even had one of those prefabricated shower jacuzzi units which wasn't really worth the effort since they need much more water pressure than the hotel is capable of providing in order to be really effective. The breakfasts were very good, and included sometimes scrambled or fried eggs. The only drawback was that the front desk was not manned all the time, which might have been a security concern. Other than that, excellent value for money in pricey Venice, with a location just steps from the train station.

HotelInfo.Name: Antica Casa Carettoni
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 130, 30121 Venice, Italy
